content:
IDataServiceHost Interface

In this Article

Interface that specifies interactions between WCF Data Services and its hosting environment.

Syntax

Declaration

public interface IDataServiceHost

Remarks

Each component that hosts WCF Data Services, such as Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) must implement this interface. IDataServiceHost is the contract between WCF Data Services and its hosting environment. This abstraction allows the WCF Data Services runtime to be agnostic to any particular hosting environment. The interface provides WCF Data Services with access to inbound HTTP requests. A new object implementing this interface is instantiated for each HTTP request and is then used to inspect properties of the HTTP request and configure the HTTP response.

Properties summary

AbsoluteRequestUri

Gets an absolute URI that is the URI as sent by the client.
AbsoluteServiceUri

Gets an absolute URI that is the root URI of the data service.
RequestAccept

The transport protocol specified by the request accept header.
RequestAcceptCharSet

Gets a string representing the value of the Accept-Charset HTTP header.
RequestContentType

Gets the transport protocol specified by the content type header.
RequestHttpMethod

Gets the request method of GET, PUT, POST, or DELETE.
RequestIfMatch

Gets the value for the If-Match header on the current request.
RequestIfNoneMatch

Gets the value for the If-None-Match header on the current request.
RequestMaxVersion

Gets the value that identifies the highest version that the request client is able to process.
RequestStream

Gets the stream that contains the HTTP request body.
RequestVersion

Gets the value that identifies the version of the request that the client submitted, possibly null.
ResponseCacheControl

Gets a string value that represents cache control information.
ResponseContentType

Gets the transport protocol of the response.
ResponseETag

Gets an eTag value that represents the state of data in response.
ResponseLocation

Gets or sets the service location.
ResponseStatusCode

Gets or sets the response code that indicates results of query.
ResponseStream

Gets the response stream to which the HTTP response body will be written.
ResponseVersion

Gets the version used by the host in the response.

Methods summary

GetQueryStringItem(String)

Gets a data item identified by the identity key contained by the parameter of the method.
ProcessException(HandleExceptionArgs)

Handles a data service exception using information in the args parameter.

Properties

  • AbsoluteRequestUri

    Gets an absolute URI that is the URI as sent by the client.

    public Uri AbsoluteRequestUri { get; }

    Property Value

    • Uri

      A string that is the absolute URI of the request.

    Remarks

    The AbsoluteRequestUri property always returns the absolute URI from the client HTTP request. This enables consistent access to the request URI, even in cases where the host revises the URI.

  • AbsoluteServiceUri

    Gets an absolute URI that is the root URI of the data service.

    public Uri AbsoluteServiceUri { get; }

    Property Value

    • Uri

      A string that is the absolute root URI of the data service.

    Remarks

    The AbsoluteServiceUri property always returns the absolute root URI of the service request. This enables consistent access to the root data service URI, even in cases where the host revises the URI.

  • RequestAccept

    The transport protocol specified by the request accept header.

    public string RequestAccept { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      String that indicates the transport protocol required by the request.

    Remarks

    Protocols currently supported by WCF Data Services include JSON and AtomPub.

  • RequestAcceptCharSet

    Gets a string representing the value of the Accept-Charset HTTP header.

    public string RequestAcceptCharSet { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      String representing the value of the Accept-Charset HTTP header.

    Remarks

    Returns null if no Accept-Charset header is present on the request.

  • RequestContentType

    Gets the transport protocol specified by the content type header.

    public string RequestContentType { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      String value that indicates content type.

    Remarks

    Protocols currently supported by WCF Data Services include JSON and AtomPub.

  • RequestHttpMethod

    Gets the request method of GET, PUT, POST, or DELETE.

    public string RequestHttpMethod { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      String value that indicates request method.

    Remarks

    For more information about the properties supported by IDataServiceHost and their use, see WCF Data Services Client Library.

  • RequestIfMatch

    Gets the value for the If-Match header on the current request.

    public string RequestIfMatch { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      String value for the If-Match header on the current request.

  • RequestIfNoneMatch

    Gets the value for the If-None-Match header on the current request.

    public string RequestIfNoneMatch { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      String value for the If-None-Match header on the current request.

  • RequestMaxVersion

    Gets the value that identifies the highest version that the request client is able to process.

    public string RequestMaxVersion { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that contains the highest version that the request client is able to process, possibly null.

  • RequestStream

    Gets the stream that contains the HTTP request body.

    public System.IO.Stream RequestStream { get; }

    Property Value

    • Stream

      Stream object that contains the request body.

  • RequestVersion

    Gets the value that identifies the version of the request that the client submitted, possibly null.

    public string RequestVersion { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that identifies the version of the request that the client submitted, possibly null.

    Remarks

    If this value is null, the version is assumed to be 1.0.

  • ResponseCacheControl

    Gets a string value that represents cache control information.

    public string ResponseCacheControl { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that represents cache control information.

  • ResponseContentType

    Gets the transport protocol of the response.

    public string ResponseContentType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      String value containing the content type.

    Example

    For more information about the properties supported by IDataServiceHost and their use, see WCF Data Services Client Library.

  • ResponseETag

    Gets an eTag value that represents the state of data in response.

    public string ResponseETag { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that represents the eTag state value.

  • ResponseLocation

    Gets or sets the service location.

    public string ResponseLocation { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      String that contains the service location.

    Remarks

    This property never returns null or string.Empty.

    Example

    The following URI contains the location of the service in the substring http://myhost/myservice.svc. 

    http://myhost/myservice.svc/Customers, the response location would be http://myhost/myservice.svc
  • ResponseStatusCode

    Gets or sets the response code that indicates results of query.

    public int ResponseStatusCode { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      Integer value that contains the response code.

  • ResponseStream

    Gets the response stream to which the HTTP response body will be written.

    public System.IO.Stream ResponseStream { get; }

    Property Value

    • Stream

      Stream object to which the response body will be written.

    Remarks

    If a null stream is returned or an exception occurs when writing to the stream, WCF Data Services aborts the request.

  • ResponseVersion

    Gets the version used by the host in the response.

    public string ResponseVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string value that contains the host version.

Methods

  • GetQueryStringItem(String)

    Gets a data item identified by the identity key contained by the parameter of the method.

    public string GetQueryStringItem (string item);

    Parameters

    • item
      String

      String value containing identity key of item requested.

    Returns

    • String

      The data item requested by the query serialized as a string.

    Remarks

    The query string portion of an WCF Data Services URI is made up of key/value pairs, with the key and value separated by the â€˜=â€™ character. GetQueryStringItem returns a data item for an identity key specified by the parameter of the method.

  • ProcessException(HandleExceptionArgs)

    Handles a data service exception using information in the args parameter.

    public void ProcessException (System.Data.Services.HandleExceptionArgs args);

    Parameters

    • args
      HandleExceptionArgs

      HandleExceptionArgs that contains information on the exception object.
